JobFullDesc: At our team in Tokyo we build the best input tools that are efficient and expressive to enable our customers to create more. We build East Asian input method editors (IME) for Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Indic languages including Hindi, for all Windows devices.  We are accountable for the touch keyboard experience for all languages on all Windows devices. We help our customers input in an efficient and expressive way with our user experiences, including emoji panel, rich content suggestions, and voice input. We are a critical part of designing and building new Windows devices that Microsoft plans to release in the future with our multi-modal input experiences. We’re looking for a strong, experienced software engineer who is passionate about building next generation text input experiences and is capable of leading the team that focuses on but not limited to Text Input features targeting the wide breadth of spoken languages beyond English/Latin originated languages.ResponsibilitiesWorking together with other disciplines such ash Program Manager (PM) and Data and Applied Scientists (DAS), you will be leading the effort to design and build text input experience that is highly competitive, with improved throughput and functions to assist customers to be more efficient and expressive. You will be in charge of designing the architecture that scales to numerous applications with seamlessly integrated experience and high quality. Holding high bar for quality of customer experience is your number 1 priority. You'll be owning an end to end scope for designing and building a critical component to the experience.QualificationsAn ideal candidate for this position should possess demonstrated ability for coding, component design, and large-scale software architecture, with product development experiences in Windows and/or similar scale operating system. We also look for the ability to work efficiently in the technology areas of data analysis, machine learning, AI and new hardware. High bandwidth communication skills are critical, both at written and spoken English. Language skills in Chinese, Japanese and other Asian languages are highly desirable.  Minimum of 5 years of software development experience with a breadth of managed/unmanaged programing languages including C/C++ is a requirement, and experiences with system level components are desired. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
